summary: the transmission of vaccine ILTV from vaccinated- to unvaccinated chickens can cause severe respiratory disease. a microarray analysis was performed to understand host-vaccine ILTV interactions at the host gene transcription level. ILTV has a linearized dsDNA genome of approximately 150 kb in size. genome encodes 80 predicted viral protein open reading frames (ORFs) ILTV infection causes respiratory disease symptoms in chickens, pheasants, partridges, and peafowl. human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) [18,19], chicken anemia virus [22], human cytomegalovirus (hCMV) [23], Epstein-Barr virus [24], infectious laryngotracheitis virus (ILTV) [25], varicella-zoster virus [26], alphaherpes virus [27], herpes simplex virus type 1 (HSV-1) [29], even in vaccine strains including recombinant flavivirus ILTV gene expression for UL35 and US5 was determined by RT-PCR. cytopathic effects were observed at 4 dpi. no significant dye effects were detected in all microarray slides. expression of 18 of the 933 differentially expressed genes was subjected to qPCR using the same RNA samples as those used in the microarray. expression pattern for 12 genes completely matched the microarray data at four dpi time points. expression pattern for the remaining 6 genes also qualitatively matched to microarray data. AGGGAGAGGAAGACGTGCTG CR352775 GGCCTTGAATGACCATCATGT AACAGCAGCAGGAACAGTGC CR385566 TGCAGCTCTACGACTACATGC CTGGGGTGATCTCT D87992 TGCAGCACTGAGACCTGTGTGTGCTCT D87992 TGCAGCACTGAGACCTGTGTGTGCT M60853 TTTTGGCTACCAGTA TTCGCCCCAGTA M the top 20 groups associated with a greatest number of genes are shown in Figure 2. Functional groups of differentially expressed genes. the top 20 functional groups are mostly related to tissue development, cellular growth and proliferation, organismal development, cell death, cellular development, cellular development, and inflammatory responses. top 10 most differentially expressed genes in ILTV vaccine infection were selected based on differences of standard deviation (SD) among all four dpi time points. the 10 most differentially expressed genes involved in functions of reduced inflammatory responses, stimulation of cell proliferation, suppression of apoptosis, and promotion of cell-to-cell interactions. up-regulation of THBS2 in vaccine ILTV infection may play a role in cell death and recovery of cells. PPIF • Peptidylprolyl isomerase F, one of the peptidyl-prolyl cis-trans isomerase (PPIase) family proteins. down-regulation of NMU may represent the inhibition of cellular factors associated with inflammation. ADAM28 is a disintegrin and metalloproteinase domain 28. up-regulated at carcinoma cells and functions proliferation and progression of human lung and breast cancer cells. IL6, one of several cytomegalovirus secreted cytokines, enhances the survival of endothelial cells by blocking caspase 3 and caspase 7-mediated apoptosis. adenovirus infection to mouse lung caused the down-regulation of AQP5 gene expression in vaccine ILTV infection from 2 to 4 dpi. the down-regulation of CCK expression in vaccine ILTV infected cells may suppress apoptosis, resulting in weak cytopathic effects. the top 4 networks were identical among all four dpi. MGAT3 (mannosyl glucosaminyltransferase 3), HS6ST1 (heparin sulfate 6-O-sulfotransferase 1), and CIRBP (cold inducible RNA binding protein) are also upregulated in vaccine ILTV infection. enzymatic antioxidants in lung cells would reduce cellular oxidative stress. 213 differentially expressed genes that responded to vaccine ILTV infection were compared to the 273 differentially expressed genes found in the previous virulent ILTV infection study. of these 25 genes, 21 showed a similar differential expression pattern as found in the virulent ILTV infection at 1 and 3 dpi. deregulation of BMP signaling is also implicated in disease states including cancer. BMPs including BMP2 mediate herpesviral reactivation found in the EBV positive cell line. ation factor, F10, is highly expressed during the early phase of SARS (severe acute respiratory syndrome) corona virus infection in human peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) expression of F10 in vaccine ILTV infections of lung cells increased at 1- and 3dpi, but the expression in virulent ILTV was not changed significantly at either 1- or 3dpi. cytopathic effect development at 0, 1, 2, 3 and 4 dpi is displayed by phase-contrast microscopic images at 200 magnification. ILTV gene expression for UL35 and US5 was determined by RT-PCR. chicken GAPDH (chGAPDH) was used as an endogenous control. qPCR results indicated that the microarray data in this experiment were valid to determine host gene expression responses against vaccine ILTV infection. the microarray data in this experiment were valid to determine host gene expression responses against vaccine ILTV infection. TGTA CCAGAGAGATATCCGCAGCA M87294 GGTGCTGACTTTCGCCTTGT GCCTGGTGATGAGGTTGATG X87609 CCACCTGAGAAAAGCGACCT ACATCGACCTCTGCCAACCT Table 2 Validation of gene expression between microarray and qPCR GenBank Symbol Fold Change (Microarray/qPCR) Day 1 Day 2 Day 3 Day 4 BX932962 SLC37A2 a subset of 213 mapped genes were categorized into 75 biologically functional groups. the top 20 groups considered based on gene number were displayed. the top 10 most differentially expressed genes were selected based on differences of standard deviation (SD) among all four dpi time points. the blue, red, green and purple bars represent 1 dpi, 2 dpi, 3 dpi, and 4 dpi for vaccine ILTV infections respectively. Mean standard deviation value of log2 fold change among four dpi time points are indicated under the gene name. PPIase family proteins and a member of the mitochondrial permeability transition (PT) pore in the inner mitochondrial membrane. down-regulation of PPIF genes in vaccine ILTV infection may play a role in cell death and recovery. the decreased expression of ADAM28 in vaccine ILTV infection may suppress the active induction of apoptosis. the decreased expression of ADAM28 may suppress the active induction of apoptosis. the decreased expression of ADAM28 may suppress the active induction of apoptosis. aquaporin 5 (AQP5) expression was elevated on 1 dpi, but decreased at 2- and 4-dpi. a deficiency AQP5 was shown to exacerbate lung injury by the infection of Pseudomonas aeruginosa. down-regulation of AQP5 gene expression in vaccine ILTV infection may be associated with reduced cytopathic effect and cell recovery. the top 4 networks were identical among all four dpi. the list, top functions, and the most focused molecules of all four networks are shown in Additional file 3. top functions related to genes in this network include free radical scavenging, lipid metabolism, and small molecule biochemistry. several enzymatic antioxidants in lung cells were assigned to network #1. this up-regulation of these enzymatic antioxidants would serve to protect cells from oxidant-mediated cell death. the green indicates down-regulation, while the red depicts up-regulation. 25 genes overlapped in both virulent strain and vaccine ILTV infections. of these 25 genes, 21 showed a similar differential expression pattern as found in the virulent ILTV infection at 1 and 3 dpi. secretion of BMP2 in both virulent and vaccine ILTV infections increased at 1dpi. increased expression level in vaccine ILTV infection was maintained until 3dpi. a functional role of increased expression and secretion of F10 in vaccine herpesvirus infected lung cells has not been studied. the vaccine ILTV infection showed weak cytopathic effects. cellular morphology recovery after initial cytopathic effects were observed. possible molecular interpretations confirmed the suppression of cell death. total RNA extraction TRIzol reagent (Invitrogen Life Technologies, Carlsbad, CA) was used to extract total RNA from uninfected- or vaccine ILTV infected chicken embryonic lung cells from 1 to 4 days post infection (dpi) total RNA treated by DNase I was re-purified by TRIzol reagent and quantified using a nanodrop1000 spectrophotometer. each 825 ng of Cy3 and Cy5 labeled cRNA probes were co-hybridized on a 4X44K Agilent chicken oligo microarray. the slides were scanned using a Genepix 4000B scanner (Molecular Devices Corporation, Sunnyvale, CA) gene specific primer sets were synthesized by Integrated DNA Technologies (Coralville, IA) three g of total RNA was converted to cDNA. qPCR was performed under conditions: 40 cycles of denaturing 95°C for 30 s, annealing at 58 - 62°C for 1 min, extending at 72°C for 30 s and finally extending at 72°C for 10 min. cells were maintained at 37°C in a 5% CO2 incubator in 10 cm culture dishes by passaging every 3-4 days in 10 ml growth medium. a modified live ILTV commercial vaccine, LT-Blen (Merial Limited, Duluth, GA), was used to infect the chicken embryonic lung cells by the amount equal to 3 vaccination doses. after incubation of infected cells for 1 h with gentle rocking every 15 min, growth medium was added to RNA Spike-in controls were synthesized from the Adenovirus E1A transcriptomes containing different concentrations of dye in each set. each 825 ng of cRNA probes were co-hybridized on a 4X44K Agilent chicken oligo microarray. genes showing both signal to noise ratio (SNR) of > 3 were considered reliable signals. low fold change values, which were less than two fold differences in all four dpi, were not considered as differential expression. fold change values representing differential expression were displayed as log2 conversions. bioinformatics software version 9.0 (Ingenuity Systems®; http://www.ingenuity.com) was used to study biological functions and molecular interactions among differentially expressed genes. the network analysis was limited to 10 networks and 35 molecules in each network to concentrate on the closest interacting focus molecules. the top functions of each network, scores and the number of focus molecules are listed in each network. focus molecules were bolded and GenBank accession number were provided for focus molecules only.
